Night Shift grins.  Like all Autobots he had not the ability to fly.  Yet, =
he could glide for short distances in Robot mode, when it came time to do h=
is spy work.  He knew that would be a dead giveaway if he did not fly.  Ano=
ther lie had to be cooked up.

" Yeah, fly, right.. I would if someone reme=
mbered ta install that capability in me.  Apparently somehow I missed the b=
oat when that feature was ben' built inta the Decepticons.  Still kinda mif=
fed about it too. Unfortunately I'm stuck stickn' ta ground travel."

Heari=
ng all this, Tucson heaves a sigh to himself.  Night Shift had once again c=
ome up with a resourceful way of getting around his incapabilities.  He won=
dered if part of himself was rubbing off on his black metallic comrade.

--=
- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
>=
 > " Now, Hydras, yeah... I thought I had the matrix covered but it turned =
out I'd been had, big time. Slaggn' son of a miserable glitch.. Ohh yeah, I=
'm not finished with Pretty boy yet, Scorponok, not by a long shot. Okay, I=
'm ready ta go explain myself ta Hydras. Too bad I ain't got anythn' better=
 ta send back ta him."
> >
> 
> Scorponok nods as Nightshift talked, doing =
a little to help Nightshift
> steady himself. With his large clawed hands h=
e snipped off the arrows
> as best as he could. Even as did so, he never le=
t his optic sensor
> stray from either the Ark nor the fallen form of Tusco=
n in the
> distance.
> 
> "We don't have much time." Scorponok said, the fa=
milliar bored
> bruskness in his voice. "No doubt more maximals and Predaco=
ns will be
> out here momentarilly." He looked at Nightshift, "You are a
> =
Decepticon, can you fly?"
> 
> (TAG)
>

ll the Decepticons could fly in robot
